intro: Brassica frutescens, commonly known as wild mustard, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring small, green, lobed leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. Its seeds are small and can be dispersed by wind, contributing to its widespread distribution. Brassica frutescens is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, where it thrives in sunny conditions.
